oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Electron near a helium liquid surface
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PATIL, SH
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: scattering
states
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The energies of an electron above a liquid-helium surface are analyzed in terms of an electron-atom polarizability potential with an infinite barrier. An integration over a layer, and a summation over different layers, leads to a one-dimensional Coulomb potential with a l/x(2) correction. This potential provides an accurate description of the observed one-dimensional Rydberg energies with a quantum defect.
